channel.title: Adding objects to pimpscape
channel.description:
How do i add objects to pimpscape ?
Thanks 79

item.title: Adding objects to pimpscape
item.dc:creator: @suomirunee suomirunee
item.description:
@suomirunee wrote:

You must have these voids: That must be over the addglobalobjects public void NewObjects() {
I show [code]public void NewObjects() {//X Y ID DIR 10 (Dir, 0=West -1=North -2=East -3=South)(Narbmark: OBJECTS)

AddGlobalObject(3364, 9767, 2038, -1, 10);//dummy @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3364, 9768, 2038, -1, 10);//dummy @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3364, 9769, 2038, -1, 10);//dummy @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3365, 9765, 377, 0, 10);//chest @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3366, 9765, 377, 0, 10);//chest @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(2889, 9695, 377, -3, 10);//chest @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3371, 9763, 299, 0, 10);//hay @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3369, 9763, 299, 0, 10);//hay @ lair train[/code]

Also I have this under them: [code]
}

public void AddGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType)[/code]
If you get errors remorve/change back the things.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding objects to pimpscape
item.dc:creator: @suomirunee suomirunee
item.description:
@suomirunee wrote:

Open client.java with notepad and search: AddGlobalObject
You should see something like this AddGlobalObject(2324, 3172, 849, -2, 10);//Spear Wall AddGlobalObject(2324, 3171, 849,-2, 10);//Spear Wall AddGlobalObject(2315, 3175, 11758, 0, 10);//bank booth @ gnome AddGlobalObject(2316, 3176, 2662, -3, 10);//barrel AddGlobalObject(2316, 3177, 2662, -3, 10);//barrel AddGlobalObject(2318, 3179, 75, -2, 10);//chest AddGlobalObject(2318, 3177, 75, 0, 10);//chest AddGlobalObject(2317, 3177, 75, 0, 10);//chest AddGlobalObject(2319, 3174, 5164, -3, 10);//sign AddGlobalObject(2310, 3182, 1032, -2, 10);//Danger Sign AddGlobalObject(2307, 3196, 4266, -1, 10);//campfire AddGlobalObject(2312, 3169, 2513, 0, 10);//target @ lettya train AddGlobalObject(2310, 3170, 360, -2, 10);//barricade attack train AddGlobalObject(2308, 3173, 354, -2, 10);//crate smash str train AddGlobalObject(2309, 3171, 3608, -2, 10);//dart shooter def train AddGlobalObject(2399, 5172, 355, -2, 10);//food crate AddGlobalObject(2382, 5161, 9390, -2, 10);//lava forge AddGlobalObject(2385, 5163, 9367, -2, 10);//hot vent door AddGlobalObject(2311, 3179, 162, -1, 10);//makine AddGlobalObject(3030, 3842, 879, -1, 10);//fountain AddGlobalObject(3029, 3842, 11745, -1, 10);//vialboxes
Add a new addglobalobject line and Iâ€™ll explain

The first number is the xcoord where it goes and the second number is the ycoord where it goes.
The third number is the object id and the fourth is the direction it is facing 0 is west -1 is north -2 is east and -3 is south.
Dont change the last number.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 23, 2008, 06:01:59 am[/size][hr]Last save and compile, if it gives errors you did something wrong.

Read full topic
